Class TimedPetriNet

  • public class TimedPetriNet
extends PetriNet

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.unc.lac.javapetriconcurrencymonitor.petrinets.PetriNet

        arcs, automaticTransitions, currentMarking, enabledTransitions, guards, hasInhibitionArcs, hasReaderArcs, hasResetArcs, inc, informedTransitions, inhibitionMatrix, initializedPetriNet, initialMarking, places, post, pre, readerMatrix, resetMatrix, transitions

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TimedPetriNet(Place[] _places, Transition[] _transitions, Arc[] _arcs, java.lang.Integer[] _initialMarking, java.lang.Integer[][] _preI, java.lang.Integer[][] _posI, java.lang.Integer[][] _I, java.lang.Boolean[][] _inhibition, java.lang.Boolean[][] _resetMatrix, java.lang.Integer[][] _readerMatrix)
      Constructs a TimedPetriNet object, which is a PetriNet object with added time semantics The enabled transitions are not calculated at initialization time, so before firing the first transition, they must be calculated PetriNet.initializePetriNet().

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected boolean[] computeEnabledTransitions()
      Computes the enabled transitions, setting the enable times for new enabled transitions only If a transition was already enabled, its timespan is not updated

    • Constructor Detail

      • TimedPetriNet

        public TimedPetriNet(Place[] _places,
                     Transition[] _transitions,
                     Arc[] _arcs,
                     java.lang.Integer[] _initialMarking,
                     java.lang.Integer[][] _preI,
                     java.lang.Integer[][] _posI,
                     java.lang.Integer[][] _I,
                     java.lang.Boolean[][] _inhibition,
                     java.lang.Boolean[][] _resetMatrix,
                     java.lang.Integer[][] _readerMatrix)
        Constructs a TimedPetriNet object, which is a PetriNet object with added time semantics The enabled transitions are not calculated at initialization time, so before firing the first transition, they must be calculated PetriNet.initializePetriNet(). Other way to start times is firing a non timed transition before a timed transition
        See Also:
        PetriNet.PetriNet(Place[], Transition[], Arc[], Integer[], Integer[][], Integer[][], Integer[][], Boolean[][], Boolean[][], Integer[][])

    • Method Detail

      • fire

        public PetriNetFireOutcome fire(int transitionIndex)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                PetriNetException
        Fires the transition specified by transitionIndex and updates the enabled transitions with their timestamps. If the petri net was not initialized before calling this method, NotInitializedPetriNetException is thrown.
        Overrides:
        fire in class PetriNet
        Parameters:
        transitionIndex - The index of the transition to be fired
        Returns:
        A status code indicating the if the fire was successful, or the failure cause
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the index is negative or greater than the last transition index.
        PetriNetException - If an error regarding the petri occurs, for instance if the net hasn't been initialized before calling this method.
        See Also:
        PetriNet.initializePetriNet(), PetriNet.fire(int)

      • fire

        public PetriNetFireOutcome fire(Transition t)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                PetriNetException
        Fires the specified transition and updates the enabled transitions with their timestamps. If the petri net was not initialized before calling this method, NotInitializedPetriNetException is thrown.
        Overrides:
        fire in class PetriNet
        Parameters:
        t - The transition to be fired
        Returns:
        A status code indicating the if the fire was successful, or the failure cause
        Throws:
        PetriNetException - If an error regarding the petri occurs, for instance if the net hasn't been initialized before calling this method.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given transition is null or its index doesn't match any existing transition
        See Also:
        PetriNet.initializePetriNet(), PetriNet.fire(Transition)

      • getEnabledTransitions

        public boolean[] getEnabledTransitions()
        Description copied from class: PetriNet
        gets the transitions array and evaluates each one if is enabled or not.
        Overrides:
        getEnabledTransitions in class PetriNet
        Returns:
        a boolean array that contains if each transition is enabled or not (true or false)

      • computeEnabledTransitions

        protected final boolean[] computeEnabledTransitions()
        Computes the enabled transitions, setting the enable times for new enabled transitions only If a transition was already enabled, its timespan is not updated
        Specified by:
        computeEnabledTransitions in class PetriNet
        Returns:
        the boolean array with enabled transitions
        See Also:
        PetriNet.computeEnabledTransitions()
